wikipedia_page.main: Dame Jayne-Anne Gadhia,  (born 19 October 1961) is a British businesswoman. She is the Founder and Executive Chair of the fintech Snoop. Jayne-Anne was the CEO of Virgin Money from 2007 to 2018 and is considered one of the financial services industry's most senior and best-known women.

response: *Jayne-Anne Gadhia (Former Chief Executive of Virgin Money UKJayne-Anne Gadhia profile in The Times Retrieved 2008-03-08)

It was reported that the deal may result in 1,500 job losses. The retail banking operation would be fronted by the Virgin Money brand and the Clydesdale and Yorkshire Bank brands would disappear from the High street. Virgin Money CEO chief executive Jayne-Anne Gadhia will be retained as a senior advisor and will receive around £1.8m redundancy, £1m bonus, £5.1m in shares to add to her existing £8.9m shares. The all-share deal buyout gave her a paper profit of around £12.5m.
* Dame Jayne-Anne Gadhia (born 1961), financial services executive

In April 2020, he added a £3 million investment in Snoop to his portfolio, an app created by former Virgin Money boss Dame Jayne-Anne Gadhia.
* Jayne-Anne Gadhia, Chief Executive Officer, Virgin Money. For services to Banking and voluntary service to the community.

She took over as Chairwoman of Virgin Money UK on 31 March 2018. This appointment created the first all-female leadership team at a major British bank, with Jayne-Anne Gadhia acting as chief executive officer.
* Jayne-Anne Gadhia (born 1961), British chief executive officer of Virgin Money
